intro: Pimpinella lineariloba, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has a taproot system. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
